thread.title: Pioneers win a slugfest to cap Saturday sweep
thread.title_full: Pioneers win a slugfest to cap Saturday sweep

author: Tyler Dahlgren
title: Pioneers win a slugfest to cap Saturday sweep
text:
Pioneers win a slugfest to cap Saturday sweep Tyler Dahlgren 0 
The way they've been swinging the bats lately, engaging in a slugfest probably isn't the best way to beat the Fort Calhoun softball team. 
Wisner-Pilger found that out the hard way on Saturday, as the Pioneers erupted for 15 runs in the final three innings to pull out a 19-10 win in their first game of a triangular hosted by the Gators. 
Fort Calhoun kept rolling in a 12-0 win over West Point-Beemer later in the day. 
The Pioneers, who improved to 14-8 with the pair of wins, scored three runs in each of the first two innings and six more in the fourth to mercy-rule the Cadets, who came into the day with a 12-10 record. 
Freshman Courtney Baxter was 2-2 and reached on all four plate appearances while driving in three runs. Senior Erin Schulz was 2-3 with a double and freshman Jordan Wear went 2-2 with a double of her own. Freshman Zoe King, sophomore Hannah Warner, juniors Lauren Nelson and Tessa Dethlefs and freshman Julie Klemm all singled. 
Sophomore Kloey Appel had a double and threw a two-hitter to earn the win. She struck out four batters, walked none, and allowed just a pair of hits. 
Against the Gators, the Pioneers jumped out to an early 4-0 lead before surrendering the next nine runs. They scored seven in the fifth and eight more in the seventh to cruise to the big victory. 
Fort Calhoun outhit Wisner-Pilger 21-16 and were led by Nelson, who finished the game a perfect 5-5 with a double and a pair of RBIs. Baxter added three more hits (she's got nine in her last three games) and a trio of RBIs. 
Schulz was 2-5 with a double and senior Jordan Coulter went 2-4. Klemm had two triples and a team-high five RBIs, a breakout game for the freshman. Warner was 2-6 and scored three times. Wear chipped in two hits and King and senior Grace Herold each finished with one. 
Fort Calhoun 12 West Point-Beemer 0
